revised_title: The Identification and Extraction of a Rennet Ferment from Withania Coagulans Seeds
tldr: The author investigates the presence of a rennet ferment in the seeds of Withania Coagulans, a plant common in Afghanistan and Northern India. The study shows that an aqueous extract of the seed-capsules can coagulate milk and has potential for use in cheese-making. The optimal extraction method involves using a 5% sodium chloride solution, and the extract can be used as a substitute for animal rennet.
